result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew A Herman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>5-15g), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)2.
  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered with tax intercept. Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs. The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b).
Obtain and maintain employment and/or school and/or vocational training.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.  Unless medically assisted treatment.
Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for 26 days served. TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew A Herman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Matthew A Herman in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Defendant Matthew A Herman in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. sdg

AS TO COUNT 6:

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made as to sentencing.  Additional statements by Nicole K.
Court sentenced defendant to serve 26 DAYS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for 26 days served. TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

AS TO COUNT 5:

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 30 MONTHS, the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 15 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 15 MONTHS. The defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
 Court IMPOSED and STAYED sentence and placed the Defendant on Probation for a period of 18 months.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
* 120 days in the House of Correction to be served as condition time, release for day reporting center .
* Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.  Unless medically assisted treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Obtain and maintain employment and/or school and/or vocational training.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered with tax intercept.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b).


  Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.

Defendant Matthew A Herman in court with attorney Cynthia M Wynn.  Brad A Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS. 

The parties have agreed to a Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court deferred prosecution agreement and participation contract.
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, entered a plea of GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgement of Conviction.  The court approved the Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement and Participant Contract and ordered the proceedings suspended for an initial period of 12 months.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6.  FILE RETAINED IN COURT.  Review hearing scheduled for June 26, 2014 at 09:30 am.
